title: What font is this? I'm attempting to recreate a sponsor logo for Hillcrest Sports
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122115514im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/hillcrestlogo_5214.jpg)
 Thanks for your help!
 [‹ What font is this?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122115514/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48361 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) 'Tonic Fabrication' heavy square industrial gothic - custom drawn logo {I C} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122115514/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46017 "Go to next forum topic")
author: rmk

comments.content: Could be [Impact](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122115514/http:/www.identifont.com/show?OZ) or [Hattenschweiler](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122115514/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haettenschweiler) when squashed vertically.

Brilliant! thanks so much, it’s Impact, 50% vertically challenged. It’s perfect! No wonder none of the automated systems could identify it. Three cheers for the trained human eye! Hup Hup Hup Hoorah! And you identified it from a bad, low res web file. Two more cheers!
Well, glad to be of help. You are very welcome.
